required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pemetrexed as the First Treatment in Advanced or Metastatic Breast Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase II Study of Alimta as First Line Chemotherapy for Advanced or Metastatic Breast Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: The purposes of this study are to determine whether pemetrexed can help patients with metastatic (cancer that has spread to other parts of the body) breast cancer, to determine any side effects that may be associated with the drug, to determine how much pemetrexed should be given to patients, and to collect DNA for future research regarding metastatic breast cancer. The collection of DNA is optional to the patient.

primary_outcome.time_frame: every 3 cycles (approximately 6-7 weeks) or until patient has disease progression

secondary_outcome.measure: Toxicity Profile: Adverse Events (Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events, Grade 3 and 4, Present in >5% of Participants)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: every 14 day cycle, and during 30-days post-therapy follow-up and long-term follow-up
every 3 cycles (approximately 6-7 weeks) or until patient has disease progression
every 3 cycles (approximately 6-7 weeks) or until patient has disease progression
every 14 day cycle, during 30-days post-therapy follow-up, and every 6 months during the long-term follow-up

intervention.description: 600 mg/m2, intravenous (IV), every 14 days until complete response or disease progression

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Must have been diagnosed with either advanced or metastatic breast cancer.
- Chemotherapy has not been given for advanced or metastatic breast cancer.
- The diagnosis of advanced or metastatic breast cancer was made at least 12 months after chemotherapy was given after breast surgery.
- Able to carry out work of a light nature (for example, light housework, office work).
- Must be at least 18 years old.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Have received prior bone marrow or peripheral stem cell transplantation.
- Have received prior chemotherapy for metastatic breast cancer.
- Are currently pregnant or breast-feeding.
- Have an active infection that your doctor decides will affect your safety.
- Are unable to take folic acid or vitamin B12.

overall_official.last_name: Call 1-877-CTLILLY (1-877-285-4559) or 1-317-615-4559 Mon - Fri 9 AM - 5 PM Eastern time (UTC/GMT - 5 hours, EST)

facility.name: For additional information regarding investigative sites for this trial, contact 1-877-CTLILLY (1-877-285-4559, 1-317-615-4559) Mon - Fri from 9 AM to 5 PM Eastern Time (UTC/GMT - 5 hours, EST), or speak with your personal physician.

group.title: Pemetrexed
group.description: 600 mg/m2, intravenous (IV), every 14 days until complete response or disease progression

participants_list.participants: Completed means that the patient was evaluable for response.

drop_withdraw_reason.title: Did not take any study drug

group.title: Pemetrexed
group.description: 600 mg/m2, intravenous (IV), every 14 days until complete response or disease progression

measure.title: Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Scale Performance Status

class.title: 3 - Partially Confined to Bed, Limited Self Care

outcome.title: Overall Tumor Response
outcome.description: Best response recorded from the start of treatment until disease progression/recurrence using Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors (RECIST) criteria that defines when participants improve ("respond"), stay the same ("stable"), or worsen ("progression") during treatment.
outcome.time_frame: every 3 cycles (approximately 6-7 weeks) or until patient has disease progression

group.title: Pemetrexed
group.description: 600 mg/m2, intravenous (IV), every 14 days until complete response or disease progression

measure.title: Overall Tumor Response
measure.description: Best response recorded from the start of treatment until disease progression/recurrence using Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors (RECIST) criteria that defines when participants improve ("respond"), stay the same ("stable"), or worsen ("progression") during treatment.

outcome.title: Toxicity Profile: Adverse Events (Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events, Grade 3 and 4, Present in >5% of Participants)
outcome.description: Participants rated for toxicity prior to each cycle using the National Cancer Institute (NCI) Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events v3.0 (CTCAE). Grades range from 0 (no AE or within normal limits) to 5 (death related to AE).
outcome.time_frame: every 14 day cycle, and during 30-days post-therapy follow-up and long-term follow-up

group.title: Pemetrexed
group.description: 600 mg/m2, intravenous (IV), every 14 days until complete response or disease progression

measure.title: Toxicity Profile: Adverse Events (Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events, Grade 3 and 4, Present in >5% of Participants)
measure.description: Participants rated for toxicity prior to each cycle using the National Cancer Institute (NCI) Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events v3.0 (CTCAE). Grades range from 0 (no AE or within normal limits) to 5 (death related to AE).

outcome.title: Duration of Tumor Response
outcome.description: Defined as time from first observation of complete response or partial response to the first observation of progressive disease or death due to any cause.
outcome.time_frame: every 3 cycles (approximately 6-7 weeks) or until patient has disease progression
outcome.population: Only applies to patients who had a complete or partial response

group.title: Pemetrexed
group.description: 600 mg/m2, intravenous (IV), every 14 days until complete response or disease progression

measure.title: Duration of Tumor Response
measure.description: Defined as time from first observation of complete response or partial response to the first observation of progressive disease or death due to any cause.
measure.population: Only applies to patients who had a complete or partial response

outcome.title: Progression-Free Survival Time
outcome.description: Defined as the time from date of first dose to the first observation of disease progression, or death due to any cause.
outcome.time_frame: every 3 cycles (approximately 6-7 weeks) or until patient has disease progression
outcome.population: Intent to treat population (in order to follow protocol, one patient who did not take study drug was excluded from this analysis)

outcome.title: Overall Survival Time
outcome.description: Defined as the time from date of first dose to time of death due to any cause.
outcome.time_frame: every 14 day cycle, during 30-days post-therapy follow-up, and every 6 months during the long-term follow-up
outcome.population: Intent to treat population (in order to follow protocol, one patient who did not take any study drug was excluded from this analysis)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
